conclusion: Understand how the position and size of the objects change when the light source moves.
A blue object on the ground.
A round object on the ground.
A rectangular object on the ground.
The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
Understand the effect of the light source's movement.
The shadows will shift accordingly when the light source moves.
The shadows will change in size based on the relative size of the objects and the light source's position.
The shadows will move to different positions on the ground, affecting the objects.
The size of the objects will change as the shadows are proportional to the size of the objects.
Conclude the changes in position and size of the objects based on the light source's movement.
The shadows of the objects will move to the right, and the objects will appear larger in the new shadow position.
